document_data.name: ''Dust of Tracelessness''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Dust of tracelessness''''' was an [[enchanted]] powder that covered up the tracks of its user and other nearby creatures.
document_data.Description: This power was typically found within finely sewn [[pouch]]es, each containing around 13 to 24 pinches-worth of the substance.
document_data.Powers:
When a pinch of this powder was into the air within an interior space, it caused a floor space of up to {{SI|1000|sq ft|long=yes}} to take on an appearance of decades of disuse, becoming dusty, dirty, laden in cobwebs. When used in an outdoor space, such as being sprinkled along a trail, a pinch of this powder would cause all evidence of the user and up to a dozen other [[human]]-sized individuals and [[horse]]s to be
erased for as far back as a {{SI|1|mile|long=yes}}. Regardless of where it was used, this powder did not produce any [[dweomer]].

Later iterations of this power in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]] were comparatively less potent, only affecting a chamber space of up to {{SI|100|sq ft|long=yes}} and only removing outdoor trails as far back as {{SI|250|ft|long=yes}} into the distance. However, these later iterations continued to leave no lingering aura after use.
document_data.Creation: Creating some ''dust of tracelessness'' required use of the [[spell]] ''[[pass without trace]]''.
